item.title: Commands, args, and ENTRYPOINTs in Kubernetes
item.description: Perhaps one of the most perplexing parts of starting a Docker container in Kubernetes is the variety of options for specifying the command to be run. A Dockerfile can include one or both of CMD and ENTRYPOINT instructions: FROM alpine CMD ["echo", "hello, world!"] FROM alpine ENTRYPOINT ["echo"] CMD ["hello, world!"] FROM alpine ENTRYPOINT ["echo", "hello, world!"] Similarly, Kubernetes has command and args fields: apiVersion: v1 kind: Pod metadata: name: hello-world spec: containers: - name: hello-world image: alpine command: ["echo"] args: ["hello, world!
